intro: Xanthophyllon clavatum, commonly known as the yellow broomweed, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its yellow flowers and hairy leaves. The plant typically grows in grassy areas and along roadsides, thriving in well-drained soils. Xanthophyllon clavatum is known for its ability to tolerate drought conditions, making it a resilient species in arid environments. Its flowers produce small seeds that are dispersed by wind, aiding in its spread across suitable habitats.
